com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces

Interface Access

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AccessTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccessStub

    public interface Access
extends Service, AccessTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Access interface provides methods to manage access control of subjects on namespaces.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Access.CreateInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Access#create vAPI operation.

      Invocable that represents the Access#delete vAPI operation.
      static interface  Access.GetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Access#get vAPI operation.
      static interface  Access.SetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Access#set vAPI operation.

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.AccessTypes

    • Method Detail

      • create

        Access.CreateInvocation create(java.lang.String namespace,
                               java.lang.String domain,
                               java.lang.String subject,
                               AccessTypes.SubjectType type,
                               AccessTypes.CreateSpec spec)
        Set up access control for the subject on given domain on the namespace.

        Operation Errors:
        AlreadyExists - if the specified principal on given domain is already associated with a role on the namespace.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotAllowedInCurrentState - if the namespace is marked for deletion or the associated cluster is being disabled.
        NotFound - if namespace cannot be located.
        InvalidArgument - if spec contains any errors or if an invalid type is specified.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have Namespaces.Configure privilege or the namespace identifier begins with "vmware-system" prefix.

        Parameters:
        namespace - Identifier for the namespace. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.
        domain - The domain of the subject.
        subject - The principal for this operation.
        type - The type of subject (USER or GROUP).
        spec - Information about the access control to be created.
        Returns:
        instance of Access.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • delete

        Access.DeleteInvocation delete(java.lang.String namespace,
                               java.lang.String domain,
                               java.lang.String subject,
                               AccessTypes.SubjectType type)
        Remove access control of the subject on given domain from the namespace.

        Operation Errors:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotAllowedInCurrentState - if the namespace is marked for deletion or the associated cluster is being disabled.
        NotFound - if namespace cannot be located.
        Unsupported - if the specified principal on given domain is not associated with the namespace.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have Namespaces.Configure privilege or the namespace identifier begins with "vmware-system" prefix.

        Parameters:
        namespace - Identifier for the namespace. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.
        domain - The domain of the subject.
        subject - The principal for this operation.
        type - The type of subject (USER or GROUP).
        Returns:
        instance of Access.DeleteInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described delete operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • set

        Access.SetInvocation set(java.lang.String namespace,
                         java.lang.String domain,
                         java.lang.String subject,
                         AccessTypes.SubjectType type,
                         AccessTypes.SetSpec spec)
        Set new access control on the namespace for the subject on given domain.

        Operation Errors:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotAllowedInCurrentState - if the namespace is marked for deletion or the associated cluster is being disabled.
        NotFound - if namespace cannot be located.
        Unsupported - if the specified principal on given domain is not associated with the namespace.
        InvalidArgument - if spec contains any errors or if an invalid type is specified.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have Namespaces.Configure privilege or the namespace identifier begins with "vmware-system" prefix.

        Parameters:
        namespace - Identifier for the namespace. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.
        domain - The domain of the subject.
        subject - The principal for this operation.
        type - The type of subject (USER or GROUP).
        spec - Information about the new access control to be assigned.
        Returns:
        instance of Access.SetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described set operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • get

        Access.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String namespace,
                         java.lang.String domain,
                         java.lang.String subject,
                         AccessTypes.SubjectType type)
        Get the information about the access control of the subject on given domain on the namespace.

        Invocation Result:
        Information about the subject including the type and the role on the namespace.

        Operation Errors:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if namespace cannot be located.
        Unsupported - if the specified principal on given domain is not associated with the namespace.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have System.Read privilege.

        Parameters:
        namespace - Identifier for the namespace. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.namespaces.Instance.
        domain - The domain of the subject.
        subject - The principal for this operation.
        type - The type of subject (USER or GROUP).
        Returns:
        instance of Access.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
